snippet: Since “A Gentleman’s Guide to Love & Murder” won the Tony for best musical, its producers are changing their marketing strategy in the hope of turning an acclaimed show into a long-running hit.
abstract: Broadway producer Joey Parnes hopes that Tony award for best musical will transform A Gentleman's Guide to Love & Murder from financially struggling show into long-running and profitable hit; prospects remain unclear, however, for somewhat tame show with cast of unknowns.
lead_paragraph: Since “A Gentleman’s Guide to Love & Murder” won the Tony for best musical, its producers are changing their marketing strategy in the hope of turning an acclaimed show into a long-running hit.

headline.main: Tony for Best Musical Is Nice, but a Profitable Hit Is Better
headline.print_headline: Tony for Best Musical Is Nice, but a Profitable Hit Is Better

keywords.value: A Gentleman's Guide to Love & Murder (Play)
